profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on February 26, 2013

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Record books, None; Probate files, 1882-1947; Wills, 1949-2009.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Thomaston, Litchfield County, Town established in July 1875, Parent Town: Plymouth

The Thomaston Probate District was constituted June 1882, from the Waterbury Probate District. The Thomaston Probate District merged with the Harwinton, Litchfield, and Northwest Corner Probate Districts on January 5, 2011, to create the Litchfield Hills Probate District. The Litchfield Hills Probate District serves the municipalities of Canaan, Cornwall, Harwinton, Kent, Litchfield, Morris, Norfolk, North Canaan, Salisbury, Sharon, Thomaston, and Warren.
Town of Thomaston, Probate District chronology:

May 1875 - June 1882, Waterbury District
June 1882 - January 4, 2011, Thomaston District
January 5, 2011 - Present, Litchfield Hills District
For Probate Court contact information and hours of operation see, .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Probate record books, None. Contact the probate court to access original record books. See Alternative Form Available note below.
Probate files, 1882-1947. Probate files may consist of estates, conservatorships, guardianships, commitments, and insolvencies. See Alternative Form Available note below.

Inventory control book, 1882-1947 (coverage). Also known as the Godard Digest, it is a list of probate files transferred to the Connecticut State Library. It was compiled at the Connecticut State Library under the direction of State Librarian George S. Godard.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Probate files in accession 1931-003 are arranged alphabetically.
Wills in accession 2013-013 are arranged alphabetically.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aid
otherfindaid.p: Record Books: Index cards for the record books have been scanned. Ask History and Genealogy staff for assistance. See Alternate Form Available section for volumes available on microfilm.

Probate Files: The Probate Estate Papers Index, located in the index corridor adjacent to the History and Genealogy Reading Room, has two parts, a general index covering most of the state, and a Hartford Probate District index covering Hartford and some surrounding towns, 1820-1920. The index cards are arranged alphabetically by individual's last name and first names. The cards have the individual's name, town of residence, probate district, and list of items contained in the estate packet. To request retrieval of an estate packet, copy at least the estate name, file date, and probate district name from the index card. The probate files in Accession 1931-003 are represented in this index.
Probate Files: The History and Genealogy reference staff has access to an index for the wills in accession 2013-013.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers should first consult use copies when available. See Alternate Form Available Section below.
Accession 2013-013, Wills, 1949-2009, is stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

Probate files dated 1921 or later are RESTRICTED pending review by State Archives staff as they may contain confidential documents. Tax returns (succession, transfer and estate tax returns and all attachments) from January 1, 1921 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §12-15. Adoptions (all documents) from January 1, 1944 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §45a-754. Removals of parent as guardian of minor (all documents) and terminations of parental rights (all documents) from October 1, 1975 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §45a-754. Contact State Archives staff for assistance. Adoptions (all documents) from January 1, 1944 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §45a-754. Contact State Archives staff for assistance.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Record books, volumes 2-9, 11, 13, 1882-1918, were microfilmed by the Genealogical Society of Utah and are available for use in the History and Genealogy reading room or through the .

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The probate files in accession 1931-003 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library on the following dates (with date span of files): August 18, 1931 (1882-1921); October 15, 1936 (1913-1930); December 14, 1949 (1920-1947). There were interfiled into one alphbetic sequence.
The wills in accession 2013-013 transferred to the Connecticut State Library on September 24, 2012.

note.p: Index of the three accessions of probate files merged into accession 1931-003
Also known as the Godard Digest
